    • Method Detail

      • startExecution

        @RequestMapping(value="/active",
                method=POST,
                params="!execute")
public void startExecution(@RequestBody
                                 ProcessInstance pi,
                                 @RequestParam(value="init-vars",required=false)
                                 boolean initVars,
                                 javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
                                 javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req)
        Starts execution of a new process instance. The processInstance representation must contain, at minimum, a processDefinitionKey element to identify the process, as well as any variables. Note that if variables are not needed, it may be more convenient to use startExecutionSimple. The response Location header will contain the URL of the newly created instance
        Parameters:
        pi -
        initVars - set to 'true' to trigger initialization of variables with default values taken from the workflow Process element
        response -
        req -

      • getProcessInstance

        @RequestMapping(value="/active/{id}.{ext}",
                method=GET)
@ResponseBody
public Object getProcessInstance(@PathVariable(value="id")
                                                    String id,
                                                    @PathVariable(value="ext")
                                                    String ext,
                                                    javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        Retrieve a specific process instance by its ID Current JBPM implementation assigns processInstanceId using the format {processKey}.{uniqueNumber}
        Parameters:
        id - the process key. If the key includes "/" character(s), the key must be doubly URL encoded. I.e. "/" becomes "%252F"
        ext - the numeric extension of the process instance, or the wildcard "*" for all instances
        response -
        Returns:
        a ProcessInstance object, if the extension specifies a single instance. If the extension is the "*" wildcard, then the return value will be an ProcessInstances object. If a single ProcessInstance is requested and it does not exist, a 404 response will be returned.

      • getAllProcessInstances

        @RequestMapping(value="/active")
@ResponseBody
public ProcessInstances getAllProcessInstances()
        Retrieve all active process instances
        Returns:
        a ProcessInstances object as XML

      • deleteProcessInstance

        @RequestMapping(value="/active/{id}.{ext}",
                method=DELETE)
public void deleteProcessInstance(@PathVariable(value="id")
                                        String id,
                                        @PathVariable(value="ext")
                                        String ext,
                                        javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        Delete a process instance, or all instances for a key
        Parameters:
        id - the process key. Doubly URL encode if it contains "/"
        ext - the process instance number, or "*" to delete all for the key
        response -

      • getProcessInstanceActivities

        @RequestMapping(value="/active/{id}.{ext}/activities")
@ResponseBody
public HistoryActivities getProcessInstanceActivities(@PathVariable(value="id")
                                                                         String id,
                                                                         @PathVariable(value="ext")
                                                                         Long ext,
                                                                         javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        Retrieve HistoryActivities for the specified process igetprocenstance. HistoryActivities include all completed and pending activities for the process. This method may be used for both open and complete ProcessInstances.
        Parameters:
        id - the process key. Doubly URL encode if it contains "/".
        ext -
        response -
        Returns:
        a HistoryActivities object as XML

      • getProcessInstanceStatus

        @RequestMapping(value="/active/{id}.{ext}/status")
@ResponseBody
public ProcessInstance getProcessInstanceStatus(@PathVariable(value="id")
                                                                   String id,
                                                                   @PathVariable(value="ext")
                                                                   Long ext,
                                                                   javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        Returns a Process object with completion status attributes set, for a specified ProcessInstance ID. The completion status attributes are computed for each activity within the process.
        Parameters:
        id - the process key. Doubly URL encode if it contains "/".
        ext -
        response -
        Returns:
        See Also:
        CompletionState

      • updateProcessInstance

        @RequestMapping(value="/active/{id}.{ext}",
                method=POST,
                params="!signal")
public void updateProcessInstance(@RequestBody
                                        ProcessInstance pi,
                                        @PathVariable(value="id")
                                        String id,
                                        @PathVariable(value="ext")
                                        String ext,
                                        javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        Update an active process instance. Only Priority and Variables will be updated.
        Parameters:
        pi -
        id - the process key. Doubly URL encode if it contains "/"
        ext -
        response -

      • startExecutionSimple

        @RequestMapping(value="/active",
                method=POST,
                params="execute")
public void startExecutionSimple(@RequestParam(value="execute")
                                       String execute,
                                       @RequestParam(value="name")
                                       String name,
                                       javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
                                       javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req)
        Simplified variation of startExecution to execute a process with no initial variables Requires no XML body content
        Parameters:
        execute - the process definition key to execute
        name - a name to be used for this process instance. Not strictly required to be unique, but as this is often used for display to users, it should at least be unique relative to other active processes.
        response -
        req -

      • getHistoryProcessInstances

        @RequestMapping(value="/history")
@ResponseBody
public ProcessInstances getHistoryProcessInstances(@RequestParam(value="key",required=false)
                                                                      String key,
                                                                      @RequestParam(value="endedAfter",required=false)
                                                                      Date endedAfter,
                                                                      @RequestParam(value="ended",defaultValue="true")
                                                                      boolean ended)
        Retrieve the history for a specified process key
        Parameters:
        key - the process definition key
        endedAfter - YYYY-MM-DD
        ended - specify 'false' to include active process instances in addition to processes that have ended, otherwise only completed processes will be included.
        Returns:
        a ProcessInstances object as XML

      • getProcessInstancesWithTasks

        @RequestMapping(value="/tasks")
@ResponseBody
public ProcessInstances getProcessInstancesWithTasks()
        Retrieve all processInstances that have open tasks, and include the tasks with the processInstance elements. This provides an efficient method of retrieving the processInstance attributes along with the task information, rather than making separate calls for the tasks and the processInstances.
        Returns:
        a ProcessInstances object as XML

      • getProcessInstancesWithTasksForAssignee

        @RequestMapping(value="/tasks",
                params="assignee")
@ResponseBody
public ProcessInstances getProcessInstancesWithTasksForAssignee(@RequestParam(value="assignee")
                                                                                   String assignee)
        Same as above, but retrieve tasks only for the specified assignee.
        Parameters:
        assignee -
        Returns:
        See Also:
        getProcessInstancesWithTasks(), TasksController.getTasksByAssignee(String assignee)

      • getProcessInstancesWithUnassignedTasks

        @RequestMapping(value="/tasks",
                params="unassigned=true")
@ResponseBody
public ProcessInstances getProcessInstancesWithUnassignedTasks()
        Same as above, but retrieve only unassigned tasks.
        Returns:
        See Also:
        getProcessInstancesWithTasks(), TasksController.getUnassignedTasks()

                                                                                    String candidate)

        See Also:
